page.title: 01Gringley:general information
page.content: 578 inhabitants:113 <18yrs old;180 >60yrs old;dormitory village;Beacon Hill - highest point above sea level; traditionally a farming community: large fenland area-the Carrs; Methodist Chapel;St.Peter's Church & Aided Primary School(C.of E.). {Ruth Thomas is 12 yrs old & lives in {Retford;she describes her first {impressions of the village.} "Weekdays:Gringley is quiet;it's small & pretty;grass verges along main streets like well-kept lawns;village is litter-free;farms - mainly arable with some pasture for sheep; countryside is bleak & empty,only fields;it has few shops ( Retford is more popular);it looks old-fashioned but I'd like living there;some houses are new;most are old cottages/farms; there's an old monument called the 'Butter Cross' by locals."
